attributes.action: change the provisions of the Communications Act 2003 and the Communications (Television Licensing) Regulations 2005, so that once a digital change-over is complete, a licence would not be required in order to install or use a television receiver to receive television programmes, since this would go to either freeview, sky, ntl or virgin services etc.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Some people have little or no regard for the television services that the BBC provide, and do not want to pay for the "priviledge" of its' services.

Why should we have to subsidise a company that ultimately has little accountability, regarding repeats and new innovative programs?

An earlier petition received a response regarding the communications act, as a way to deflect the removal of the license fee - well - change the law so we don't have to pay once we are all digital..

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
